book_idea: A 9-year-old boy adapts to life during the tariff wars of Trump’s term, learning resilience and resourcefulness as trade battles shake his small town in 2027.
author_voice: Warm, relatable, and hopeful, weaving real-world trade issues into a kid-friendly adventure that teaches grit and empathy for 9-12 year-olds.

protagonist.name: Ethan Carter
protagonist.description: A 4th-grader from rural Ohio, a scrappy and kind kid who loves fixing things and trading baseball cards. He’s smart but gets frustrated when plans fail.

antagonist.name: Economic Ripple Effects
antagonist.description: The unseen chaos of tariffs—higher prices, job worries, and town tension—that disrupts Ethan’s world, showing how big decisions hit small lives.

cast_of_characters.name: Liam Carter
cast_of_characters.description: 14-year-old high school freshman, moody but protective, upset about losing his part-time job.

cast_of_characters.name: Mr. Tom Grayson
cast_of_characters.description: 45-year-old gruff but caring teacher, helps Ethan build projects and understand change.

cast_of_characters.name: Sophie Nguyen
cast_of_characters.description: 9-year-old spunky girl, trades crafts and keeps Ethan laughing despite tough times.

cast_of_characters.name: Mr. Dave Carter
cast_of_characters.description: 38-year-old factory worker, stressed about layoffs but hides it from Ethan.

cast_of_characters.name: Mrs. Kelly Carter
cast_of_characters.description: 36-year-old nurse, practical and upbeat, keeps the family steady.

cast_of_characters.name: Grandpa Joe
cast_of_characters.description: 68-year-old retired mechanic, shares stories of hard times and fixes stuff with Ethan.

cast_of_characters.name: Mrs. Linda Hayes
cast_of_characters.description: 50-year-old owner of the local hardware store, grumbles about pricey supplies.

cast_of_characters.name: Jake Miller
cast_of_characters.description: 10-year-old loud kid, brags about his dad’s new job but misses the old days.

cast_of_characters.name: Mayor Patel
cast_of_characters.description: 42-year-old hopeful mayor, tries to calm folks but faces tariff complaints.

cast_of_characters.name: Ms. Ellie Brooks
cast_of_characters.description: 30-year-old quiet helper, teaches Ethan about trade with old books.

locations: Rural Ohio town (Ethan’s home and school, a tight-knit place hit by trade shifts)
Carter family garage (a messy workshop where Ethan tinkers)
Main Street (local stores struggling with costs and empty shelves)
plot_points: Opening Scene: Ethan trades baseball cards in the schoolyard, noticing prices are up.
Inciting Incident: Dad comes home worried about factory cuts, sparking Ethan’s questions.
First Plot Point: Ethan starts fixing old bikes to trade, seeing how tariffs touch everything.
Midpoint Reversal: The hardware store raises prices, halting Ethan’s bike project.
Second Pinch Point: Liam loses his job, and Ethan feels the family strain.
Low Point: Ethan’s best bike trade flops, leaving him stuck and mad.
Second Plot Point: Ethan and Sophie plan a town swap fair in the garage.
Climactic Sequence: The fair helps neighbors share goods, lifting spirits despite tariffs.
themes: Resilience and Adaptation: Bouncing back when big changes hit home.
Community Strength: Working together beats going it alone.
Understanding Trade: Seeing how far-off decisions affect daily life.
Making Do with Less: Finding value in what you’ve got.
Hope Amid Uncertainty: Keeping spirits up when things get tough.
revelations: Ethan learns that tariffs aren’t just about money—they change how people live, pushing him to start a swap fair to help his town.

character_arcs.arc: From frustrated kid to resourceful leader, learning to fix problems and rally friends.
From sulky teen to team player, finding purpose by helping Ethan’s fair.

special_instructions: Ground it in today’s tariff tensions—like U.S.-China trade spats—without guessing exact 2027 outcomes. Keep it simple and uplifting for 9-12 year-olds, teaching about economics through Ethan’s eyes.
